description: PWA + Polish - Enable PWA installation with app icon and fullscreen mode, evaluate desktop card width, and achieve WCAG AA color accessibility compliance

userStories.title: PWA Support - Icon + Fullscreen
userStories.description: As a mobile user, I want to install 2000nl to my home screen and use it in fullscreen mode so that I have an app-like experience without browser chrome. Offline functionality is explicitly out of scope - when offline, the app shows 'Please connect' message.
acceptanceCriteria: Create manifest.json with app metadata (name, short_name, description, start_url, display: standalone, theme_color, background_color, icons)
Generate icon assets: 192x192, 512x512 (Android), 180x180 (Apple touch icon)
Add manifest link to apps/ui/app/layout.tsx
Add meta tags: theme-color, mobile-web-app-capable, apple-mobile-web-app-capable, apple-mobile-web-app-status-bar-style, apple-mobile-web-app-title
Add offline detection banner with message: You're offline. Please connect to continue
Test installation on iOS Safari (Add to Home Screen)
Test installation on Android Chrome (Install app prompt)
Test installation on desktop Chrome/Edge
Verify app opens in standalone/fullscreen mode (no browser UI)
App icon appears correctly on home screen
Lighthouse PWA installability checks pass
Screenshots showing: install prompt, home screen icon, fullscreen mode
Typecheck passes: npx tsc --noEmit
Verify in browser using Chrome DevTools MCP

userStories.title: Desktop Card Width Evaluation
userStories.description: As a developer, I want to evaluate whether desktop cards should expand width when text doesn't fit (like mobile) or maintain fixed width with scrolling, so that we choose the approach with best readability and user experience.
acceptanceCriteria: Use Chrome DevTools MCP to test current fixed-width behavior with long content
Measure current line length in characters
Screenshot current behavior showing scrolling with long content
Temporarily test expansion approach (modify width classes)
Screenshot expanded behavior
Measure line length in expanded approach
Research typography best practices for optimal line length (50-75 characters)
Document pros/cons of both approaches
Make decision: fixed width, expand with max-width, or full expansion
Document decision with clear reasoning in progress notes
If implementing change: Update card width classes in TrainingCard.tsx
If implementing change: Test on multiple desktop viewports (1280px, 1440px, 1920px)
If implementing change: Verify no horizontal scroll on standard viewports
If implementing change: Verify line length within optimal range
Screenshots documenting comparison and final decision
Typecheck passes: npx tsc --noEmit
Verify in browser using Chrome DevTools MCP

userStories.title: Color Accessibility Improvements
userStories.description: As a user with visual impairments or color-blindness, I want the app to meet WCAG AA accessibility standards so that I can effectively use all features regardless of my vision capabilities.
acceptanceCriteria: Read Tailwind config and extract all colors with hex values
Document all color usage contexts (primary, secondary, background, text, badges, buttons, etc.)
Map all text/background color combinations used in app
Calculate contrast ratios for all combinations using WebAIM Contrast Checker
Create matrix of failing combinations (those below 4.5:1 for normal text or 3:1 for large text)
Generate alternative colors for failing pairs using Tanaguru Contrast-Finder
Test color scheme with color-blindness simulators (protanopia, deuteranopia, tritanopia, achromatopsia)
Verify semantic colors remain distinguishable (success vs error vs warning)
Update Tailwind config with WCAG AA compliant colors
Preserve brand identity by adjusting saturation/lightness, not hue
Test changes in browser using Chrome DevTools MCP
Screenshot before/after comparisons of key components
Visual regression testing on cards, navbar, buttons, badges
Run Lighthouse accessibility audit
Lighthouse accessibility score > 90
Document color usage guidelines in apps/ui/docs/accessibility-colors.md
All text meets 4.5:1 contrast ratio (normal text) or 3:1 (large text â‰¥18pt)
No visual regressions or unexpected color changes
Typecheck passes: npx tsc --noEmit
Verify in browser using Chrome DevTools MCP
